00062 typedef struct NVRAM_tag_sDevice
00063 {
00064         IMG_BOOL                bDeviceInitialised;
00065         
00066         /* Chip select the device is on */
00067         SPIM_eDevice    eChipSelect;                    
00068         /* Number of blocks(pages) in the device */
00069         img_uint32              ui32NumBlocks;                  
00070         /* Block(page) size */
00071         img_uint32              ui32BlockSize;                  
00072         /* Address width, in bytes */
00073         img_uint8               ui8AddressWidth;                
00074         /* For devices which don't support arbitrary byte writes. This causes a
00075            Block read/modify/write back function to be used. Eg: the M25PE80 flash
00076            must be written using this function. */
00077         img_bool                bUseAPIWriteN;
00078         /* Set to true to use the custom write instruction, as specified in ui8WriteInstr */
00079         img_bool                bOverrideWriteInstr;
00080         /* Custom write instruction, if different from 0x02 */
00081         img_uint8               ui8WriteInstr;
00082         /* Sets the erase instruction if the device supports one. */
00083         img_uint8               ui8EraseInstr;
00084         /* Set to true if the device doesn't have an explicit erase operation. The erase function used
00085            will write a block of 0's to the device. */
00086         img_bool                bUseAPIErase;
00087         /* Override status register read instruction */
00088         img_bool                bOverrideStatusRegBehaviour;
00089         /* Status register read opcode */
00090         img_uint8               ui8StatusRegInstr;
00091         /* Status register ready bit */
00092         img_uint8               ui8StatusRegReadyBit;
00093         /* Value of status register ready bit indicating readiness (1/0) */
00094         img_uint8               ui8StatusRegReadyBitReadyValue;
00095         /* Override read instruction */
00096         img_bool                bOverrideReadInstr;
00097         /* Read instr opcode */
00098         img_uint8               ui8ReadInstr;
00099         /* Number of padding bytes after address */
00100         img_uint8               ui8PaddingBytes;
00101         /* Use a write enable phase */
00102         img_bool                bUseWriteEnable;
00103         /* Block(page) address bit base - use this if the address bytes are split into a block(page) address and byte address 
00104            This is usually necessary for devices with non-power-of-two block(page) sizes */
00105         img_uint8               ui8BlockAddressBitBase;
00106         
00107 } NVRAM_sDevice;
